name: Air-Fried Sweet and Sour Chicken Wings
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Sweet, sour, crispy, and sticky wings without the mess of deep-frying.
directions: Preheat the air fryer to 380 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Place wings in a large bowl
Drizzle oil over the top, sprinkle with salt, and stir until evenly combined
Place 1/2 of the wings in the air fryer basket, skin side down
Flip wings over using tongs and cook for 10 minutes more
Increase temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Flip wings over and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes more
Meanwhile, combine sugar, vinegar, water, soy sauce, cornstarch, and ketchup in a saucepan over medium-high heat
Whisk until sauce has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes
Turn heat off and let cool slightly
Place wings in a large bowl
Pour sauce over the top, toss to coat, and serve immediately
